element.name: Sidetracked - Balally LUAS by Hezekiah, Traditional Cache (1/1)
element.long-description:
Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
The Luas Green Line runs from St. Stephen’s Green to Sandyford and the trip takes about 22 minutes.
Side-Tracked Caches are intended to provide quick cache-and-dashes at train stations.
The Cache is a small micro container - please re-hide it well to ensure that the commuting muggles don’t discover it.
Bring a pen / pencil, as the cache may be too small to hold one! This cache is placed outside the station, so access does not necessarily involve fares, tickets, etc.

ul.li:
2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by Lynjas
On our 3rd visit and with some help from Fitzet we finally found this one. TFTC.

2010-06-04T21:30:16Z : Found it by Fitzet
Found after dropping our cub to his bank holiday weekend camp at larch hill. Found the cache and then understood the clue. Trust the gps! SL TFTC

2010-05-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by merann
We were up and down quite a few times before we finally found this cache and as soon as we found it we noticed nearby the persons from the hint. SL. TFTC, Merann.

2010-04-05T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Lynjas
Didn't figure out clue so can't find cache. But plan to return and try again!

2010-04-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by Toffee Man
After searching all around for a while we eventually found "Eddy is Jonny" & got the cache. TFTC Toffee Man #279
